channel.title: BBC News - Science & Environment
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Asteroid that wiped out dinosaurs shaped fortunes of snakes
item.description: Snakes owe their success in part to the asteroid impact that killed off the dinosaurs 66 million years ago.

item.title: Climate change: Young people very worried - survey
item.description: Over half of respondents in a survey believe humanity is doomed and governments are failing to act.

item.title: Climate change: World now sees twice as many days over 50C
item.description: BBC research finds the number of days passing 50C has doubled in the past 40 years.

item.title: Green jobs: The new generation of workers making it work for them
item.description: Science editor David Shukman on three jobs in growing green industries, and what it's like to do them

item.title: COP26: UK still lagging on climate policy, report says
item.description: UK policies will deliver a quarter of emissions cuts needed, say campaigners ahead of the COP26 summit.

item.title: Record number of environmental activists murdered
item.description: More than 220 environment and land rights activists were murdered last year, according to a report.

item.title: TUC: Jobs at risk if UK fails to hit carbon emissions target
item.description: Trade bodies and unions say the UK is slipping behind other nations on green investment.

item.title: COP26: Poorest countries fear not reaching UK for climate summit
item.description: Twenty of the world's poorest countries face hotel quarantine before the event in Glasgow.

item.title: Climate change: Fossil fuels must stay underground, scientists say
item.description: Almost 60% of oil and gas and 90% of coal must stay in the ground to keep global warming below 1.5C.

item.title: UK 'cut climate pledges' to clinch Australia trade deal
item.description: Government ministers agreed to cut climate commitments to clinch the deal it has emerged.

item.title: How green is Scotland's space industry?
item.description: Scotland's thriving space sector is trying to have a reduced impact on the planet.

item.title: International Space Station: Smoke triggers alert on board
item.description: The alarm went off as the space station's batteries were being charged, Russia's space agency says.

item.title: Climate change: Vulnerable nations call for 'emergency pact'
item.description: The countries at greatest risk say all nations must take bigger steps to avoid climate catastrophe.

item.title: Climate change: Dragonflies spread north in warming world
item.description: The expansion of dragonflies across Britain and Ireland is an indicator of climate change, say experts.

item.title: Climate change: Massive Attack gig data to cut live music impact
item.description: Artists should swap private jets for trains among recommendations from climate scientists.

item.title: Climate change: Arctic warming linked to colder winters
item.description: A new study connects the heating of the Arctic region to extreme winter weather in the US.

item.title: Then and now: Why deforestation is such a hot topic
item.description: Trees are part of the solution for climate change, but are we felling more than we are planting?

item.title: Climate-above-all plea by US fails to stir China
item.description: Envoy John Kerry's 'it's more important than politics' appeal falls on deaf ears.

item.title: One in three trees face extinction in wild, says new report
item.description: Experts say 17,500 tree species are at risk around the world, including magnolias, oaks and maples.

item.title: Pulsar discoverer awarded Royal Society's highest prize
item.description: Astrophysicist Dame Jocelyn Bell Burnell is only the second woman to be awarded the Copley Medal.

item.title: Astronomers see galaxies in ultra-high definition
item.description: Researchers capture some of the most detailed images ever seen of galaxies in deep space.

item.title: Bezos sues Nasa over its deal with Elon Musk's SpaceX
item.description: Mr Bezos's Blue Origin says it was unfairly treated after being excluded from lunar landing contract.

item.title: Saving Australian frog species on the brink of extinction
item.description: Scientists fear four species are already extinct but say urgent action can save others.

item.title: Spider season: Why your home might feel full of arachnids right now
item.description: They're not coming through the windows - they were already inside.

item.title: Tuna bounce back, but sharks in 'desperate' decline
item.description: Extinction list update reveals mixed news for marine life, as world conservation summit open in France.

item.title: Wildlife photo: Is this the world's most beautiful mosquito?
item.description: Both beauty and beast. A Sabethes mosquito is visually stunning but it's also a carrier of disease.

item.title: Majestic birds caught by the camera
item.description: A selection of the winners in this year's Bird Photographer of the Year competition.

item.title: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards 2021 finalists revealed
item.description: An angry starling and a lounging bear were also among the competition finalists.
